author: Ella Chew
title: Important Reminders as Winter Weather Approaches
text:
WEST LAFAYETTE, Ind. (WLFI) -
Two winter storm systems are set to impact the area over the next few days, bringing a mix of ice, snow, and freezing temperatures.
INDOT is already gearing up for the severe weather, with plans to begin road preparations Thursday afternoon.
"With the fact we know there are a couple systems coming in we're getting ready for that. We've already started our anti-icing operations out on the roadway," said Blake Dollier, Public Relations Director for INDOT West Central.
More than a dozen trucks are set to treat roads ahead of the first storm surge, with additional crews ready for the second system expected to hit on Sunday
"With all that said we are all hands on deck," Dollier said.
Several drivers will be on standby to respond as needed.
"Winter operations is on call 24/7, it doesn't matter if it's New Years Day, it doesn't matter if its a weekend or holiday, no matter what our drivers are going to be ready to go out there," Dollier said.
INDOT isn't the only agency on standby during these storm systems—first responders are also getting ready. Winter weather often leads to more hazardous driving conditions, and first responders typically see an increase in calls as the snow and ice move in.
"Take your time when you have to travel. Leave earlier, leave some distances in between vehicles and pay attention to your surroundings," said Ashley Sneathen, a Lafayette Firefighter.
The Lafayette Fire Department has received two sets of bunker gear for each call, allowing firefighters to rotate their gear, including gloves and hoods.
"As far as us on the engines and the trucks, we have to be mindful of our surroundings as well especially when we're responding emergent. We have to be very careful when we're driving and approaching busy intersections," said Sneathen.
Sneathen advised keeping a safety kit in your car, stocked with essential items. Having these supplies on hand is crucial in case drivers find themselves stranded on the road.
For those staying indoors, there are also some important tips to remember as the temperatures drop.
"Make sure that you're keeping those space heaters at least three feet away from drapery curtains, anything that's combustible that can easily ignite, keep those areas clear from that and make sure you're not overloading extension cords," Sneathen said.
Dollier stressed the need to continue emphasizing safety precautions, especially given how long it's been since the area experienced a storm system with this level of potential. It's been at least two winters since a significant winter storm has passed through.
"This has the potential to be a lot bigger system than we've seen before. With that comes the need for extra preparations, maybe some extra meetings to discuss our plans, maybe some extra warning in advance which is what we're trying to do right here," Dollier said. "Of course we don't want to worry anybody but we do want to be prepared and that's why we're putting a heavier importance on this one. Yes it might not be the first snow, but this one is certainly looking to be a bigger winter weather event."
Dollier also recommended using the 511 INDOT Trafficwise Map to stay informed and up to date.

author: VNExplorer
title: Los cambios avanzan: renunció el Secretario de Ciencia y Tecnología mientras Karina Milei nombró a 5 nuevos funcionarios
text: Luego de la salida del Nicolás Posse de la Jefatura de Gabinete siguen las renuncias en el Gobierno de Javier Milei. Este jueves se confirmó la renuncia de Alejandro Cosentino, secretario de Innovación, Ciencia y Tecnología, en medio de una crisis de financiamiento que atraviesa el área. Por otro lado, la secretaria General de la Presidencia, Karina Milei, designó nuevos funcionarios para formalizar su equipo de trabajo. El alejamiento de Cosentino de la Administración libertaria se dio por los cambios estructurales que atraviesa el área, ya que la Secretaría de Ciencia y Tecnología se encuentra dentro del organigrama que ahora conduce Guillermo Francos. El ahora exfuncionario ayudó en la transición y no se descarta que pueda asumir en otro rol. Guillermo Francos anticipó "más recortes" si el Congreso insiste con la fórmula jubilatoria: "No tenemos los recursos" Según trascendió, el Gobierno estaría planificando separar la parte de Innovación y Tecnología de la de Ciencia, lo que también implica un cambio de funciones para el co creador de la fintech Afluenta. Asimismo, Cosentino también formaba parte del círculo de confianza de Posse, especialmente por el manejo de las telecomunicaciones. El exministro coordinador fue desplazado el pasado 26 de mayo, días después de que el Presidente manifestara que "todo el Gabinete está bajo revisión", cuando, según los rumores. su salida era inminente. Guillermo Francos y Nicolás Posse. El área que conducía el ahora exsecretario nacional registra una fuerte caída en la ejecución presupuestaria, ya que según el Centro Iberoamericano de Investigación, Ciencia e Innovación (CIICTI), hubo una retracción interanual del 20,9% en el primer cuatrimestre de 2024 en Ciencia y Tecnología. Los 5 nombramientos de Karina Milei Por su parte, la hermana del fundador de La Libertad Avanza -una de sus colaboradoras más cercanas-, continúa designando funcionarios para formalizar su equipo de trabajo al frente de la Secretaría General de la Presidencia y sorprendió por el nombramiento de hasta un "director creativo". El área a cargo de Karina Milei destacó este jueves con cinco nombramientos, todos con "carácter transitorio" y por "un período de 180 días hábiles", acorde a la información manifestada en las resoluciones del Boletín Oficial. Este martes, ya había oficializado a Juan Pablo Carreira, el militante libertario conocido en la red social X como "Juan Doe", como director nacional de Comunicación Digital. Karina Milei, secretaria General de la Presidencia. Ahora se hicieron formales las designaciones de Iván Gabriel Gómez como coordinador de Gestión de Comunicación Digital, Walter Ezequiel Carrera como director creativo de la Dirección Nacional de Contenidos Audiovisuales e Imagen Institucional del Gobierno y Javier Nicolás Di Prizito como director de Campañas de la Dirección Nacional de Planificación y Seguimiento. Los tres flamantes funcionarios iniciaron con sus roles a partir del pasado 10 de abril, al igual que Carreira. Los otros dos nombramientos incluyen a Leandro Martín Leiva Nostas, en el cargo de director de Comunicación de la Vocería, y de Santiago Gregorio Pacheco, como coordinador de Postproducción Audiovisual de la Dirección de Realización Audiovisual de la Presidencia. En sus casos, sus contratos iniciaron el pasado 1 de mayo. Según consigna la agencia NA, las tareas de los jóvenes funcionarios libertarios están estrechamente ligadas a la producción de imágenes y videos oficialistas, que luego se difunden mediante las redes sociales, herramienta clave en la comunicación presidencial. FP CP

author: Matt Durr | mattdurr@mlive.com
title: Walmart food recalls issued nationwide: oysters, electric scooters, teething sticks on list
text:
MLive file photo. (Mike Krebs | MLive.com) Mike Krebs | MLive.com
By Matt Durr | mattdurr@mlive.com As the nation’s largest retailer, recalls on products sold at Walmart can impact millions of Americans. With 90% of Americans living within 10 miles of a Walmart, keeping up with items that have been recalled at Walmart stores is important for many shoppers.
Items such as food, medication, housewares and more can be recalled for a variety of reasons and can impact your home well after you’ve purchased them.
“Walmart and Sam’s Club are committed to the health and safety of our customers and members and to providing products that are safe and compliant, all supported by our health and wellness, product safety, and food safety professionals,” the company said in a statement. “In the event of a product recall, we work swiftly to block the item from being sold and remove it from our stores and clubs.”
Here are the latest product recalls from Walmart:
Food recalls
Genova®, Van Camp’s®, H-E-B and Trader Joe’s brand canned tuna – Recalled due to food poisoning risk from manufacturing defect that may compromise the product seal. The products were sold at Walmart under the Genova and Van Camp’s labels in Alabama, Arkansas, Arizona, California, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Louisiana, Missouri, Mississippi, North Carolina, Nevada, New Jersey, New Mexico, Ohio, Oregon, South Carolina, Tennessee, Texas and Washington.
Louisiana Oysters – Recalled after 191 confirmed cases of norovirus. The products were sold in Louisiana and Mississippi.
Gerber Sooth N Chew Teething Sticks – Recalled due to choking hazard for babies and young children. The products were sold nationwide.
Pearl Milling Company Original Pancake & Waffle Mix – Recalled due to the possibility of undeclared milk. Those with an allergy or severe sensitivity to milk could run the risk of a serious of life-threatening allergic reaction. The recall is limited to 11 states: Arkansas, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Minnesota, Mississippi, Nebraska, Utah and Wisconsin.
Great Value Chicken Broth – The 48 oz. size was recalled to packaging issues that could result in spoilage. It was sold in nine states: Alabama, Arkansas, Georgia, Louisiana, Missouri, Mississippi, Oklahoma, Tennessee and Texas.
Medication recalls
Fentanyl Transdermal System 25 mcg/h transdermal patches – The products were recalled due to the potential they could be stacked and adhere to the top of one another. The transdermal system was manufactured by Kindeva Drug Delivery L.P., Northridge, Calif. and distributed nationwide by Alvogen, Inc.
Product recalls
Walmart recalls 18K electric scooters that can catch fire, offers full refund Jazwares recalls America’s Got Talent microphones with lithium-ion batteries due to fire hazard LG recalls electric ranges due to fire hazard AliExpress Multi-Styler Hair Dryers due to electrocution or shock hazards Vornado Air VH2 Whole Room Heather due to electric shock and fire hazards HAITEATBNB Electric Immersion Water heaters due to fire and burn hazards Lexmark International Recalls Specialty Printers Due to Fire Hazard Northern Tool + Equipment Recalls Adjustable Swivel Shop Stools with Backrests Due to Fall Hazard Lexmark International Specialty Printers due to fire hazard Northern Tool + Equipment Adjustable Swivel Shop Stools with Backrests due to fall hazard If you purchase a product or register for an account through a link on our site, we may receive compensation. By using this site, you consent to our User Agreement and agree that your clicks, interactions, and personal information may be collected, recorded, and/or stored by us and social media and other third-party partners in accordance with our Privacy Policy.

author: Max DELANY
title: NATO leaders vow to stand by Ukraine as doubts hang over Biden

author: Clearwater Threshers
title: Thursday's Game Postponed Due to Unplayable Grounds
text:
Thursday's Game Postponed Due to Unplayable Grounds
August 29, 2024 -
Florida State League (FSL) Clearwater Threshers News Release
FORT MYERS, FL - With heavy rains for much of the afternoon affecting the grounds on the field Thursday's game between the Clearwater Threshers and Fort Myers Mighty Mussels has been suspended due to unplayable field conditions at Hammond Stadium. The game will be made up on Friday, August 30 as part of a doubleheader, with game one to begin with a 4:30 first pitch. Both games of the doubleheader will be seven innings.
The Threshers continue their final road trip of the 2024 regular season against the Fort Myers Mighty Mussels on Friday, August 30...First pitch of the doubleheader will be at 4:30 PM EST...You can purchase Threshers tickets at ThreshersBaseball.com/tickets or by calling 727-467-4457...The Box Office at BayCare Ballpark is also open daily to purchase Threshers tickets...The hours are 10 AM-5 PM Monday through Friday and 10 AM-3 PM on Saturdays.
